definition: to install (water pipes, landmines etc) underground
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: The basic status of burying the borehole inclinometers are introduced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了钻孔测斜仪埋设情况。

sentences.english: The Japanese planted a flag on Di oy Island.
sentences.chinese: 日本的国旗上埋设了钓鱼岛。

sentences.english: All the roads leading to the city had been mined.
sentences.chinese: 所有通往这座城市的道路都埋设了地雷。

sentences.english: Laying underground electricity lines used in cable boxes in to line for the community to Wu.
sentences.chinese: 使用地下埋设线路供电的，以电缆进线兀接箱为界。

sentences.english: He was using maritime forces to lay mines.
sentences.chinese: 他用海上部队埋设地雷，这些都是合法的目标。

sentences.english: Dark fiber refers to unused fiber-optic cables that have been laid out in the field.
sentences.chinese: 暗光纤是预先埋设的，还没有使用的光纤。

sentences.english: This creates losses 40 times higher in a buried cable than in an aerial one.
sentences.chinese: 在地下埋设电缆造成的损失是空中架设的40倍。

sentences.english: Pile embedded in rock is pile foundation whose shaft is embedded partly or entirely in rock.
sentences.chinese: 嵌岩桩是指桩身一部分或全部埋设于岩石的桩基础。

definition: to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to lay (railroad tracks, carpet, pipeline)/to install (wiring, cable)/to construct (road, concrete slab)
defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
pipeline/general term for pipes, cables etc
